sen.j: 折衝都尉の魯寧なる者が横暴であったため、これを鞭打って殺害した。
sen.e: 魯寧, Sesshoi Toi (The chief of negotiation), was so arrogant that he whipped and killed 魯寧.
sen.cmt: 魯寧→定訳不明のため原文のままとしています。
sen.e: 魯寧, Setsushiyoutoi (The chief of negotiation), was so arrogant that Ryu Jinki whipped and killed him.

sen.e: 魯寧, Setsushiyoutoi (The chief of negotiation), was so arrogant that Ryu Jinki whipped and killed him.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 太宗 (唐)に詰問されると、「臣（私）が辱められたために殺しました」と臆せずに答えた。
sen.e: When Taiso, Tang tai zong questioned him about it, he answered by saying 'I killed him because he insulted me.'
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: When Taiso (Tai Zong; Emperor of Tang Dynasty) questioned him about the death, he answered without hesitation, 'I killed him because he insulted me.'
sen.cmt: ・太宗は唐の皇帝なので、英訳でもそのように修正しました。・itだけでは具体的に何かが分かりにくいので、直前の内容を参考に修正しました。・「臆せず」にあたる英訳がなかったので追加しました。
sen.e: When Taiso (Tai Zong; Emperor of Tang Dynasty) questioned him about the death, he answered without hesitation, 'I killed him because he insulted me.'
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: このことから、かえって太宗に気に入られ、咸陽の丞に任ぜられた。
sen.e: Taiso was pleased with his answer, and appointed him to jo of Xianyang.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Taiso was pleased with his answer rather than angry about it, and appointed him to jo of Xianyang.

sen.j: 給事中にまで昇るが、ために権臣の李義府に憎まれるようになり、青州刺史に左遷される。
sen.e: He was promoted to 給事中, but was transferred to shishi (Provincial Governor) in Qingzhou because 李義府, a influential vassal, was jealous of and hated him.

sen.j: さらに顕慶5年（660年）の遼東半島征伐において漕運に失敗した罪を着せられ、59歳にして一兵卒に落とされた。
sen.e: Further, he was charged the blame on the failure of transportation in the Liaodong Peninsula conquest in 660, and was demoted to the ranks at the age of fifty nine.
Furthermore, he was charged the blame on the failure of transportation in the Liaodong Peninsula conquest in 660, and was demoted to the ranks at the age of fifty nine.

sen.j: この年、蘇定方率いる唐軍が百済の都泗ビを攻め、配下の劉仁願が義慈王を捕らえる功績を挙げ、百済を滅亡させる。
sen.e: When the Tang army led by So Teiho attacked Shibi, the capital of Paekche; Kudara (Paekche) in this year, Rui Jinki made a great performance by capturing Baekje, destroying Paekche; Kudara (Paekche).
When the Tang army led by So Teiho attacked Shibi, the capital of Kudara (Paekche) in this year, Rui Jinki made a great performance by capturing Uija and destroying Kudara.
sen.cmt: ・Paekcheが重複していたので一方を削除しました。・「義慈王」は用語集の「百済の義慈王」を参考に変更しました。
sen.e: When the Tang army led by So Teiho attacked Shibi, the capital of Kudara (Paekche) in this year, Rui Jinki made a great performance by capturing Uija and destroying Kudara.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: しかし、翌龍朔元（661年）百済の遺臣鬼室福信らが泗&amp27800城の奪還を試み、守将の劉仁願を包囲した。
sen.e: In the following year, in 661, the surviving retainers of Paekche; Kudara (Paekche) including Fukushin Kishitsu attempted to regain the Shibi Castle of 劉仁願 by encircling 劉仁願, a defense general.
sen.cmt: 泗&amp27800城→wikipedia で確認し、劉仁願泗沘城として訳出しました。
sen.e: In the following year, in 661, the surviving retainers of Kudara including Fukushin Kishitsu attempted to regain the Shibi Castle by encircling Ryu Jingan, a defense general.
sen.cmt: ・Paekcheが重複していたので一方を削除しました。・「劉仁願」はあるサイトによれば「りゅうじんがん」と読むようです。http://kotobank.jp/word/%E5%8A%89%E4%BB%81%E9%A1%98
sen.e: In the following year, in 661, the surviving retainers of Kudara including Fukushin Kishitsu attempted to regain the Shibi Castle by encircling Ryu Jingan, a defense general.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 龍朔3年（663年）9月、百済残党を支援する倭（日本）の水軍を白村江で迎撃し、400余隻の軍船を焼き払って大勝する（白村江の戦い）。
sen.e: In September in 663, he attacked the Suigun (warriors battle in the sea) of Wa (Japan) which supported the remnants of Baekje at Baekgang, winning a great victory, burning out more than 400 warships (Battle of Hakusukinoe).

In September in 663, he attacked the Suigun (warriors battle in the sea) of Wa (Japan) which supported the remnants of Kudara, winning a great victory, burning out more than 400 warships (Battle of Hakusukinoe).
sen.cmt: ・「百済」の英訳が前述と異なっていたのでKudaraに統一しました。
sen.e: In September in 663, he attacked the Suigun (warriors battle in the sea) of Wa (Japan) which supported the remnants of Kudara, winning a great victory, burning out more than 400 warships (Battle of Hakusukinoe).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.e: When Gao Zong had Hozen (festival of heaven and earth) at Taizan in 665, he participated in it with the chieftains of four countries; Silla (Kingdom), Kudara (Paekche), 耽羅, and Wa.
